e0a676072ad63194ba1110210357175e3c0e8925.question: How do I create an account?

response.answer: To create an account in HRCare, visit the signup page and provide your organization’s legal name, billing contact, and relevant tax information. Designate an initial admin who will have full access to configure users, roles, integrations, and system-wide policies. Small teams can self-serve entirely online, while enterprise customers needing additional support should contact Sales for guided assistance.

context_used.content: To create an organization account in HRCare, visit the signup page and provide your organization’s legal name, billing contact, and relevant tax information. Designate an initial admin who will have full access to configure users, roles, integrations, and system-wide policies. Small teams can self-serve entirely online, completing all steps without assistance, while enterprise customers requiring SSO integration, sandbox testing, or migration of legacy data should contact Sales for guided support

. Once the account is created, the admin can set default permissions, add users, configure approval workflows, and enforce compliance rules such as password policies, IP restrictions, and session timeout rules. Automated confirmation emails and detailed step-by-step instructions guide new admins through account setup. HRCare ensures seamless onboarding, secure access, and alignment with organizational policies. Admins also receive notifications for account activities and system updates, helping maintain oversight and compliance

Admins can invite new users to HRCare by navigating to Settings → Users → Invite. Invitations require the recipient’s email and an assigned role. Role templates include Admin, HR Manager, Manager, Employee, or custom roles configured under Settings → Roles. Admins can define access limits for sensitive features, such as payroll, performance management, and reporting tools. Invited users complete their profile, set a secure password, and optionally enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for additional protection. Automated reminders notify users of pending invitations, reducing delays

05dc5b41841beb7197aa3f24ba66a84fddb003a6.question: can I do hiring with your service?

response.answer: Yes, you can do hiring with the HRCare service. It offers a full suite of hiring tools, including job posting management, candidate pipelines, resume parsing, interview scheduling, configurable scorecards, offer workflows, and e-signature support. It also integrates with major job boards and social platforms to streamline candidate sourcing.

context_used.content: The HRCare ATS offers a full suite of hiring tools, including job posting management, candidate pipelines, resume parsing, interview scheduling, configurable scorecards, offer workflows with approval routing, and e-signature support. Integration with major job boards and social platforms streamlines candidate sourcing. Automated notifications, reminders, and task assignments reduce manual workload, while structured interviews and weighted competencies improve consistency and fairness in hiring decisions. All activities are time-stamped, logged, and exportable for compliance audits
Background checks are supported through integration partners. HR can order checks and track statuses within HRCare to ensure compliant hiring practices.

HRCare enables organizations to track candidates through configurable stages of the hiring pipeline using scorecards and status updates. Each candidate’s progress is logged and timestamped, providing a complete audit trail. Admins can export data for compliance reporting, analyzing time-to-hire, rejection reasons, and offer acceptance rates. Communication templates ensure consistent messaging for interview requests, rejections, and offers, while automated reminders keep candidates and hiring managers on schedule

response.answer: HRCare offers a wide range of HR services, including built-in reports for HR and business operations, payroll reconciliation, compliance reporting, and support for background checks through integration partners. Additionally, it provides native connectors for ADP, Gusto, QuickBooks Payroll, and Paychex, with the ability to integrate other providers via SFTP, CSV exports, or API.

context_used.content: HRCare offers a wide range of built-in reports for HR and business operations, including headcount summaries, turnover analysis, time-off utilization, hiring funnel metrics, payroll reconciliation, and compliance reporting. Reports can be generated on-demand or scheduled for periodic delivery via email or dashboard notifications. Users can filter data by department, location, role, or employment type, providing granular insights for decision-making

HRCare provides native connectors for ADP, Gusto, QuickBooks Payroll, and Paychex. Other providers can be integrated via SFTP, CSV exports, or API. Mapping tools ensure fields are validated before exports to maintain accuracy.
Background checks are supported through integration partners. HR can order checks and track statuses within HRCare to ensure compliant hiring practices.
